summary: I know it’s been a long time since Dan Howell posted his video ‘Daniel and Depression’, but I figured that I’d type up the post...
body:
I know it’s been a long time since Dan Howell posted his video ‘Daniel and Depression’, but I figured that I’d type up the post I’ve been meaning to say to him for a long time.

Thank you, Dan.

A lot of people don’t understand clinical depression, and your video helped them to do so.

I am thankful that you posted that video, because it helped me feel like a wasn’t alone in how it felt. I don’t feel so utterly alone.

In the comments, I saw many people say that they agreed or they related, and that is the perfect example of how you coming out with depression may have been hard, but was a wonderful and brave thing to do.

I have been watching both yours and Phil’s videos for years. I’ve watched as you grew up; more so, with me! I may be much younger than you, but I feel that I know you both well enough to say that you are part of my childhood.

When you posted that video, I first saw the title and thought it might be some joke or something… but it wasn’t. I’m glad it wasn’t. That might make me sound selfish, as you suffered from the depression that you posted about in a video that helped me get better, but it’s true.

Thank you so, so very much, Dan Howell. I grew up with you. You don’t know me; I haven’t even been to a tour with you… but I count you as my friend.

Thank you.

blog.name: awkward-orchid-jj
blog.title: Jouska
blog.description:
(n.) a hypothetical conversation that you compulsively play out in your head. 
A space to fan out | Fanfiction 
- Jess x

body:
You cant save everyone // Perfect

This is my first imagine I’ve written in a long time… so if it’s a bit rusty, forgive me xx

I looked down at my watch as I walked through the door. It had been a long day at work, a double shift. Spending 24 hours in the trauma casualty department was not for everyone but I loved it. The emergencies being rushed through the doors and into the resuscitation bay always gave me a rush of adrenalin, what felt like minutes took hours but the best part of my job was saving lives. Some deaths are inevitable, its the first thing they teach you in med school. 

But today was different…

The breaks had failed on a double-decker bus, it went hurdling into the middle of a cycling race, passengers, cyclists and bystanders were brought into Trauma. Out of the one hundred and sixty-four patients that had been brought in, only seventy survived. 

I kicked off my shoes and took off my jacket and left them neatly by the door, my feet ached. A long sigh left my lips as a put my bag down and finally relaxed. I was starving, all I had eaten were energy bars. I needed to decompress, the day was still heavy on my shoulders. 

I flicked on the light in the living room to see Dan sleeping on the couch. A small blanket hung off his legs, he must have waited for me. Not forgetting about my disgusting body-fluid stained scrubs I quickly washed up, a hot shower was exactly what I needed right now.

“Hey darling” Dan stood outside the bathroom.

“Hun” I wrapped my arms around his neck, letting my body fall against his. We stood like that for a few minutes, just holding each other. Dan’s arms loosened from my waist and his hands took their place on my hips. “long day” His eyes softened, “I heard the news”. My face must have told him everything, or maybe it was a tears welling up in my eyes. “y/n” Dan held my face in his hands, “Don’t beat yourself up” His thumbs wiped away a few stray tears. He took my hand and lead me to our room, it had been our room since I moved in with Dan and Phil. Dan would correct me every time I called it his room. “Phil cooked dinner, we still dished up for you” He sat me down on the bed. “I’ll be back, just going to warm it up for you” He turned his back, I couldn’t care for food now, all I wanted was to be with Dan. I reached out and grabbed his shirt, “Just stay with me… please” 

Dan smiled sympathetically, “okay my love”. He took off his shirt and switched off the light before getting into bed. “I’m sorry you had a hard shift” he wrapped his arm around my shoulders and pulled me into his chest. “I couldn’t save everyone, Dan” I pressed my face into his chest. I wrapped myself around him, feeling his skin against mine, creating a safe place, a memory not only to remember but to feel. Dan laced his fingers into my hair, massaging my neck. “You can’t save everyone, y/n, but I know you do everything to try.” His free hand pulled my leg over his hips. “You do everything in your will and everything in your power, some people might not want to survive, some people have their time and that’s something you can’t control.” Dan kissed my forehead and then my lips, even after his lips had left mine I swear I could feel them still lingering. “Get some sleep my love, in the morning I’ll massage your feet and give you breakfast in bed and we’ll have the best day possible-” I cut him off with a kiss, pressing hard against his lips. “I love you so much, Daniel Howell, my husband”. He smiled, he always did when I called him that, my husband. “With your terribly dark humour and my sad sarcasm, what kingdom can’t we conquer?” His nose brushed mine as he pressed his forehead against mine. “I love you” he spoke softly, and whispered something that I couldn’t quite make out. We fell asleep tangled in one another. Perfect

tags: a shower curtain would be nice
summary: A Shower Curtain Would Be Nice【﻿𝘋𝘢𝘯𝘪𝘦𝘭 𝘏𝘰𝘸𝘦𝘭𝘭】
title: A Shower Curtain Would Be Nice【﻿𝘋𝘢𝘯𝘪𝘦𝘭 𝘏𝘰𝘸𝘦𝘭𝘭】
body:
【𝘠𝘖𝘜 𝘈𝘙𝘌 𝘙𝘌𝘈𝘋𝘐𝘕𝘎 𝘗𝘈𝘙𝘛 𝘚𝘌𝘝𝘌𝘕】

【𝘍𝘢𝘯𝘥𝘰𝘮】Dan and Phil

【﻿𝘗𝘢𝘪𝘳𝘪𝘯𝘨】Daniel Howell/ Reader (she/her)

【﻿𝘙𝘦𝘲𝘶𝘦𝘴𝘵𝘦𝘥】No, @wukindly, @wolfhard-tozier, @goshdarnitthatsalongname, @the-best-fanfition-ever

【𝘞𝘢𝘳𝘯𝘪𝘯𝘨𝘴】None

【﻿𝘞𝘰𝘳𝘥 𝘊𝘰𝘶𝘯𝘵】735

【﻿𝘒𝘦𝘺𝘴】(Y/n) = Your name, (f/b) = favorite band, (D/n) = Dog’s name

【﻿𝘚𝘶𝘮𝘮𝘢𝘳𝘺】You’re nervous to meet Dan and not even a forced bath would change that

【Lethal Games Bring Lethal Fans Masterlist】【Linktree】

Keep reading

You smiled, despite how you felt on the inside. On the inside, you were screaming. You didn’t know how to feel. You were going to meet Daniel James Howell, the person you had had a crush on for at least nine years. Sure, it was just an internet crush, but now you lived in the same country. Hell, your brother was his best friend. This measly internet crush was growing into so much more.

“What did you say you needed again?” Phil asked. You swallowed before clearing your throat.

“Flour, salt, eggs, water, ground beef, ground veal, butter, a clove of garlic, spinach, parsley, Romano cheese, and nutmeg.” You replied. Phil nodded.

“When do you plan on going to the bank?” He asked before sending the text and slipping his phone into his pocket. You thought for a second before shrugging.

“Either tonight or early tomorrow morning.” You replied. He nodded.

“Well, I’m ready to leave whenever you are,” Phil said. You lifted your wrist and looked at your watch. 6:42. You chewed on your lip in thought.

“Give me like 20 minutes so I can take a shower. Wash all the airplane ick off.” You replied. Phil nodded. You walked around your living room, peering at all the boxes and looking for the one marked clothes. After about a minute of searching, you finally found it. You pulled out the first shirt, pair of pants, and undergarments you could find. A (f/b) t-shirt and a pair of jeans. It would do.

You grabbed your travel bag and headed the bathroom. You sighed heavily as you stared at the shower. There’s no fucking curtain, you thought as you rubbed your forehead. You sighed and shook your head. Bathing it is. You set your bag and clothes down before turning on the hot water faucet and turning the cold one so the temperature was just right. You placed the bath stopper in the drain and waited for the tub to fill up and once it was about 75% full you switched off the faucets.

You quickly stripped yourself of your clothes before sinking into the warm water. You sighed as it encased you. It was incredibly relaxing and you wished you could stay submerged in the rejuvenating element forever but you knew you had to hurry. You leaned your head back and made sure your hair was soaked before you reached over the sill and grabbed your travel sized bottles of shampoo, conditioner, and body wash.

You lathered your hair until you were satisfied with the suds and dunked your head, washing out the remnant soap. You repeated that with the conditioner and then quickly washed your body. You carefully stood and grabbed your towel from your bag. After drying quickly you dressed at the same speed. You grabbed your brush and raked through the strands before putting on deodorant. You looked in the mirror and sighed. Not exactly what I would’ve liked to meet him in, but what can I do?

“Alright, I’m ready. Just need to put my shoes on.” You said as you opened the door. Phil glanced over his shoulder and nodded. You skipped on a pair of socks and the shoes you had worn on your flight, not feeling like fishing out another pair. You stood up and glanced at Phil as he patted his pockets to make sure he had everything.

“Hey, do you mind if (D/n) comes? She’s been cooped up in that truck without me for like 11 hours, I’d hate to leave her here for another two.” You said. Phil laughed before nodding.

“Oh yeah, of course. I don’t mind and I highly doubt Dan will.” Phil replied. You smiled and nodded.

“Come on (D/n), let’s go.” You said as you grabbed your phone, your charger, and your keys. You opened the door and waited as Phil walked out, (D/n) following. You closed the door and upon locking it, Phil began to signal for a Taxi. One stopped and Phil gave him the address as you opened the door for (D/n). You got in after her and Phil got in after you. You swallowed as a million things ran through your head. You were on your way to meet Daniel Howell and cook him dinner. Life in London truly was turning out to be an adventure.

“Oh yeah, of course. I don’t mind and I highly doubt Dan will.” Phil replied. You smiled and nodded.

“Come on (D/n), let’s go.” You said as you grabbed your phone, your charger, and your keys. You opened the door and waited as Phil walked out, (D/n) following. You closed the door and upon locking it, Phil began to signal for a Taxi. One stopped and Phil gave him the address as you opened the door for (D/n). You got in after her and Phil got in after you. You swallowed as a million things ran through your head. You were on your way to meet Daniel Howell and cook him dinner. Life in London truly was turning out to be an adventure.
